text: Anisophyllea beccariana is a tree of tropical Asia in the family Anisophylleaceae. It is named for the Italian botanist Odoardo Beccari. ==Description== Anisophyllea beccariana grows as a tree up to tall. Its bark is flaky or scaly. The ellipsoid fruits measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Anisophyllea beccariana grows naturally in Sumatra and Borneo. Its habitat is mixed dipterocarp and kerangas forests from sea-level to about altitude. ==References== beccariana Category:Trees of Sumatra Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1875 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Henri Ernest Baillon
title: Anisophyllea beccariana
